title.narrative: Madagascar Emergency Support to Critical Education, Health and Nutrition Services Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to preserve critical education, health and nutrition service delivery in targeted vulnerable areas in the recipient’s territory.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Establishment of the Technical steering committee | DueDate :25-Apr-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.A.2 (a) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Establishment of the projectcoordination cell | Due Date :09-May-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.A.3 (c) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Terms of reference of PIU staff | DueDate :09-May-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.B.4 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Adoption of a regulation on school grants| Due Date :25-Jul-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.D.2 (a) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Publication of a revised medical wastemanagement plan | Due Date :30-Sep-2014
Finance Agreement :Section I.E.2 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Transmission of Annual plan and budget toIDA for approbation | Due Date :25-May-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.F.1 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Updated Education, Health and NutritionManuals | Due Date :25-Jul-2013
Finance Agreement :Section I.F.2 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Adoption of Project Implementation Manual| Due Date :17-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :Section II.B.4 of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Engagement of independent auditors forthe carrying out of audits of the Recipient’s financial statement | Due Date :31-Dec-2013
Finance Agreement :Section IV.B.1 (b) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Payment Agreements signed and PaymentAccount opened | Due Date :30-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Section IV.B.1 (c) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | Description :Payment Agreements signed and PaymentAccount opened; School Grant Regulation adopted | Due Date :31-Aug-2013

title.narrative: School grants paid by the project on time
Percentage of facilities visited by the district technical assistants
Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
Births (deliveries) attended by skilled health personnel (number)
Number of community teachers certified to be in service paid
Number of children receiving anti-helminth treatment (school age children)
Number of teachers trained in school health and nutrition activities
People with access to a basic package of health, nutrition, or reproductive health services (number)
Children immunized - under 12 months against DTP3 (number)
Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)
Number of schools supported by ACN during de-worming
Total number of schools receiving school grants funded by the project
Number of parents' associations/school management committees trained on teacher accountability process and use of school grants year
Number of children under 2 years enrolled in the growth monitoring program
Number of Community Nutrition Agents trained to provide health and nutrition education
Number of children enrolled in the MUAC program between 2-5 years of age
percentage of Nutrition sites Monthly Report submitted within +5 days of the end of the month through mobile phones
Children under the age of 24 months benefiting from improved infant and young child feeding (IYCF) practices
Students enrolled in primary schools in targeted regions
Percentage of women attending antenatal clinic who are tested for syphilis
Number of households receiving support kits (inputs and equipment) for short cycle agriculture and livestock activities
